KlustersView Class Reference

The KlustersView class provides the view widgets for the document instance (KlustersDoc instance) and is displayed as a MDI child window in the main view area of the KlustersApp class instance. More...

#include <klustersview.h>

Collaboration diagram for KlustersView:

[legend]
List of all members.

enum  DisplayType {
  CLUSTERS = 0, WAVEFORMS = 1, CORRELATIONS = 2, OVERVIEW = 3,
  GROUPING_ASSISTANT_VIEW = 4, ERROR_MATRIX = 5, TRACES = 6
}
 Enum indicating wich type of view the user wants.

class KlustersDoc

Detailed Description

The KlustersView class provides the view widgets for the document instance (KlustersDoc instance) and is displayed as a MDI child window in the main view area of the KlustersApp class instance.

The document instance keeps a list of all views that represent the document contents as there can be more than one view. Views get created in KlustersApp::createDisplay() and automatically added to the list of views. The KlustersView class inherits QWidget as a KDockArea to give it the ability to contains dockWidgets.

Author:
Lynn Hazan

QPtrList< QValueList< int > >  undoList = QPtrList< QValueList< int > >(),
QPtrList< QValueList< int > >  redoList = QPtrList< QValueList< int > >() 
)

Constructs a view.

Parameters:
mainWindow a reference on the main window of the application.
doc the document instance the view represents.
backgroundColor color used as background.
initialDimensionX initial dimension to be presented on the abscissa axis.
initialDdimensionY initial dimension to be presented on the ordinate axis.
initialClusterList list of cluster to be shown at the opening of the view.
type a DisplayType giving the way the document has to be presented.
parent the parent QWidget.
name name of the widget (can be used for introspection).
wflags common QWidget flags.
statusBar a reference to the application status bar.
timeInterval time interval between 2 time lines drawn in the ClusterView.
maxAmplitude initial gain use to draw the waveforms in the WaveformView.
positions positions of the channels to use in the view set by the user in the settings dialog.
isTimeFrameMode whether the Waveform View (if any) is in timeFrame mode.
start initial time of the time frame use by the WaveformView (if any).
timeFrameWidth initial amount of time for the time frame use by the WaveformView (if any).
nbSpkToDisplay initial number of spikes to display for each cluster when the waveform presentation mode is sample.
overLay boolean indicating if the waveforms are overlaping each other.
mean boolean indicating if the means and standard deviation are displayed.
binSize initial bin size used by the CorrelationView.
correlationTimeFrame initial time amount, in second, of the time frame used by the CorrelationView.
scale initial type of scale used to present the correlation data.
shoulderLine boolean indicating if a doted line is drawn at the shoulder level of the correlograms.
startingTime starting time in miliseconds used in the TraceView.
duration time window in miliseconds used in the TraceView.
labelsDisplay true if labels are drawn next to the traces, false otherwise.
undoList list of list of removed clusters used to enable undo action.
redoList list of list of removed clusters used to enable redo action.

void KlustersView::addNewClusterToView ( QValueList< int > &  fromClusters,
int  clusterId,
QValueList< int > &  emptiedClusters,
bool  active 
)

Adds a newly created cluster to those already shown.

This method aims to reduce the number of clusters to draw.

Parameters:
fromClusters list of clusters from which the spikes of the new cluster are coming.
clusterId cluster to add to the clusters already drawn.
emptiedClusters list clusters numbers which became empty because all their spikes were put in the new one.
active true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

void KlustersView::addNewClustersToView ( QMap< int, int > &  fromToNewClusterIds,
QValueList< int > &  emptiedClusters,
bool  active 
)

Adds newly created clusters to those already shown.

This method aims to reduce the number of clusters to draw.

Parameters:
fromToNewClusterIds map where the keys are ids of the clusters which really contained spikes in the region and the values are the ids of the newly created clusters.
emptiedClusters list clusters numbers which became empty because all their spikes were put in the new one.
active true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

void KlustersView::undo ( QValueList< int > &  addedClusters,
QValueList< int > &  updatedClusters,
bool  active 
)

Reverts the last user action.

If any clusters have been removed they will be added back The clusters in addedClusters, if present in shownClusters, will be removed and the clusters in modifiedClusters,if present in shownClusters, will be updated.

Parameters:
addedClusters list of clusters which were added.
updatedClusters list of clusters which were modified .
active true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

void KlustersView::redo ( bool  active,
QValueList< int > &  deletedClusters 
)

Revers the last undo action.

active true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

void KlustersView::redoAddedClusters ( QValueList< int > &  addedClusters,
bool  active,
QValueList< int > &  deletedClusters 
)

Reverts the last undo action.

If any clusters have been added back in the undo they will be removed again if they are shown. The clusters in addedClusters will be added back.

Parameters:
addedClusters list of clusters which were added
active true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.
deletedClusters list of clusters which were deleted.

void KlustersView::redoModifiedClusters ( QValueList< int > &  updatedClusters,
bool  isModifiedByDeletion,
bool  active,
QValueList< int > &  deletedClusters 
)

Reverts the last undo action.

If any clusters have been added back in the undo they will be removed again if they are shown. The boolean isModifiedByDeletion is used to reduce the number of cluster to redraw whenever possible. The clusters in modifiedClusters, if present in shownClusters, will be updated.

Parameters:
updatedClusters list of clusters which were modified.
isModifiedByDeletion true if the clusters of updatedClusters have been modified by the deletion of spikes (moved to cluster 0 or 1, cluster of artefact and cluster of noise respectively).
active true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.
deletedClusters list of clusters which were deleted.

void KlustersView::redo ( QValueList< int > &  addedClusters,
QValueList< int > &  modifiedClusters,
bool  isModifiedByDeletion,
bool  active,
QValueList< int > &  deletedClusters 
)

Reverts the last undo action.

If any clusters have been added back in the undo they will be removed again if they are shown. The boolean isModifiedByDeletion is used to reduce the number of cluster to redraw whenever possible. The clusters in addedClusters will be added back and the clusters in modifiedClusters,if present in shownClusters, will be updated.

Parameters:
addedClusters list of clusters which were added.
modifiedClusters list of clusters which were modified.
isModifiedByDeletion true if the clusters of updatedClusters have been modified by the deletion of spikes (moved to cluster 0 or 1, cluster of artefact and cluster of noise respectively).
active true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.
deletedClusters list of clusters which were deleted.

void KlustersView::renumberClusters ( QMap< int, int > &  clusterIdsOldNew,
bool  active 
)

Updates the list of clusterIds shown using the new ids.

Parameters:
clusterIdsOldNew map given for each old clusterId the new clusterId.
active true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

bool KlustersView::isThreadsRunning (  ) 

Enables the caller to know if there is any thread running link to this view, meaning launch by any of the view's viewWidget.

If at least one is running the method returns true, if none are running the method return false.

void KlustersView::updateShoulderLine ( bool  b  )  [inline]

Update the presentation of a doted line at the shoulder level on the correlograms of the Correlation View if any.

void KlustersView::closeEvent ( QCloseEvent *  e  )  [protected]

overwritten QWidget::closeEvent() to catch closing views.

Does nothing, as the closeEvents for KlustersView's are processed by KlustersApp::eventFilter(), so this overwitten closeEvent is necessary and has to be empty. Don't overwrite this method !

QEvent *  event 
) [protected]
